Title.evidence: Early Peritoneal Dialysis in Newborns Post-Cardiac Surgery: A Retrospective Cohort Study

Participants.evidence: This retrospective single-center study was conducted at the Children's Hospital of Mississippi, involving 49 newborns who underwent congenital heart surgery

Intervention.evidence: Newborns with prolonged CPB times (>180 minutes), postoperative oligoanuria, and/or inability to achieve negative fluid balance within 24 hours were selected for early PD (PD [+]).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were 5% fluid accumulation at 48 hours and severe AKI on postoperative day (POD) 5.

Number_Randomised.evidence: involving 49 newborns who underwent congenital heart surgery between January 2012 and December 2015.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 49 newborns, 29 were initiated on early PD, while 20 used the PD catheter as an abdominal drain.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The early PD group had significantly less urine output on POD 1 (0.98 vs. 3.02 ml/kg per hour; P = 0.001).
